Name: Pattern Recognition - PE

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: For Case C001: Activities are: Initiate Request, Verify Documents, Call Customer, Submit Additional, Verify Documents (again), Approve Request. Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The context for the first Verify Documents is that the agent checks the initial set of submitted identity documents. However, the second Verify Documents occurs after the Submit Additional activity where the customer provided an additional ID scan. Thus, the second Verify Documents could be interpreted as a re-verification or subsequent verification once additional documents are provided. To make a clear distinction, we could rename: First Verify Documents to Verify Initial Documents. Second Verify Documents to Verify Additional Documents.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE

Text: Based on the Additional Context column, a more case-specific and context-aware renaming might be: 1. For C001: First Call Customer should be Call Customer for Missing Docs. 2. For C002: First Call Customer should be Call Customer for Account Clarification. Second Call Customer should be Follow-up Call Customer after Account Adjustment. 3. Name: Validation - PE
Text: This makes the new event log: Case C001 with renamed activities: Verify Initial Documents, Call Customer for Missing Docs, Submit Additional Documents, Verify Additional Documents. Case C002 with renamed activities: Verify Documents, Call Customer for Account Clarification, Adjust Account, Follow-up Call Customer after Account Adjustment. Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Justification for Naming Choices: 1. Verify Initial Documents vs. Verify Additional Documents (for C001): Verify Initial Documents is used for the first round of document verification where the agent checks the initially provided documents. Verify Additional Documents is used for the second round of verification where the agent checks the additional ID scan provided by the customer after the first round was incomplete. 2. Verify Initial Documents vs. Re-verify Documents After Adjustment (for C003): Verify Initial Documents is used for the first round of document verification where the BranchOfficer performs a physical verification of the ID. Re-verify Documents After Adjustment is used for the second round of verification which occurs after an account adjustment has been made, making it necessary to verify again after the Adjust Account event. 3. Call Customer activities have been renamed based on the specific context mentioned in the Additional Context column: For C001, Call Customer for Missing Docs makes it clear that the call is to request additional missing documents. For C002, Call Customer for Account Clarification makes it clear that the first call is to clarify a discrepancy in the account details, while Follow-up Call Customer after Account Adjustment makes it clear that the second call is a follow-up after an account adjustment has been made. For C003, Call Customer to Return to Branch makes it clear that the call is made because the customer stepped out and needs to return to continue the process.
